oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EFFECT OF CHEMICALLY ADDED ZIRCONIA AND YTTRIA ON THE MECHANICAL-PROPERTIES OF ZIRCONIA-DISPERSED ALUMINA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RANJBAR, K
RAO, BT
MOHAN, TRR
HARENDRANATH, CS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fracture-toughness
al2o3-zro2 composites
microcracking
ceramics
phase
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alumina powders dispersed with monoclinic, tetragonal, and cubic zirconia were prepared by evaporating a colloidal dispersion. of alumina powders in. solutions containing zirconium and yttrium salts. The dried and calcined powders were compacted, sintered, and characterized. The results demonstrated a clear toughening effect by the zirconia on the alumina ceramics. The alumina containing 20-omega t%-yttria-stabilized tetragonal zirconia had the maximum toughness.
